TLINE.TDLINE: &USE&
Within the maintenance of contract types, these are created and
modified.
Caution: The maintenance of the contract types is not subjected to the
general parameters of SAP customizing and therefore is defined depending
on a system and the selected client. This way, modifications can be set
live within a short term. Consequently, the adaptations must be
performed separately in all system environments.
You access the definition of contract types via the view cluster
/GICOM/VC_CONTR. Within the maintenance of the contract types, the
corresponding folders are assigned to the contract type that is to be
adjusted. Initially, a list of all defined contract types is displayed.
You new entries can be defined, existing entries can be view and edited.
&PRECONDITIONS&
&STANDARD_SETUP&
&ACTIVITY&
A contract type is defined by the combination of contract type ID, a
description, a validity period and the underlying agreement model.
Furthermore, you can define different attributes for a contract type, a
description of these is following. Primarily, the header data of the
contract type are defined. Now, you create the individual subareas to be
assigned to the contract type.
The information on creation and modification is completed by the system.
The data entries are saved onto the following tables:
* /GICOM/TCNT_TYP
* /GICOM/TCNT_TYPT
* /GICOM/TCNT_TCTY
* /GICOM/TCNT_TROV
* /GICOM/TCNT_TDOC
Within the details of a contract type the following fields need to be
maintained:
Contract type: Within this field freely selected ID is maintained to
define the contract. A maximum of 4 digits is allowed for the ID.
Valid from/until: A validity period is defined, within which the
settings are valid for this contract type. By default the "Until" field
is preset with the value 31.12.9999.
Agreement model: Within this field it can be chosen on which agreements
model the contract type is based. Further information can be seen within
the user guide AD.
Possible selections are:
ü,,Supplier contract
ü,,Customer contract
ü,,Internal customer contract
ü,,Distribution contract
ü,,Operating contract
ü,,Template
If AD is used exclusively, only the model "Vendor contract" is relevant.
Change: This field defines, whether changes can be made within an active
contract. The following selections can be entered
No It is not allowed to edit an active
contract at all.
Yes, directly Editing an active contract is partially
allowed. The changeable
attributes are defined within
customizing.
Yes, via Addendum An active contract may only be edited via an
addendum, which will
eventually be released and set
active.
Techn Validity: When activating this checkbox, limited contracts may
receive a technical infinite validity.
CCS Integration Control
§,,Checkbox "Transfer to CCS":
When activating this checkbox, the active contracts of this type are
transferred to the CCS via the interface for settlement. This requires a
separate CCS customizing.
Features
§,,Activate conditions
When this is activated, the condition tab in the contract maintenance is
shown which enables a creation of conditions in contracts of this
contract type.
§,,Non-mon. agreements
When this is activated, the tab for Dynamic Appendix (NMAs) in the
contract maintenance is shown which enables the creation of non-monetary
agreements in contracts of this type. The assignment of Dynamic Appendix
to a contract type, is maintained within the view cluster
/GICOM/VC_TDYN.
Contract release
§,,Approval y./n.
Within this field you define whether the contract type is based on a
release process or not. If a release process is required, the creation
of an approval is mandatory. If the field is inactivated, the contract
is directly activated in status 70. You still create an approval, in
order to be able to send for example info news via email about contract
releases.
Step1: Contract types - texts
In this sub-item you define the description of the contract type for
different languages.
It is mandatory to enter at least one entry in this tab. You enter the
description in the view cluster maintenance /GICOM/VC_CONTR within the
corresponding contract types.
·,,Language: In the field language, you enter the language key for which
the description is created. The language must be saved in the SAP
language table and is selected via a search help or entered manually.
·,,Title contract type: The description for the selected contract type
is defined, depending on a language.
·,,Acronym: An abbreviation of the contract type is entered for each
language.
Step2: Condition types
Within the contract type definition, it is possible to assign condition
type groups to a contract type.
Only the condition types of the assigned group and the individually
assigned condition types are later allowed for the condition maintenance
for this contract type.
Entries are optional. If no entries are made, all conditions will be
allowed for this contract type. The entries can be recorded within the
view cluster /GICOM/VC_CONTR. To define the assignment the older
“Assigned condition types to contract type” is selected and the entries
are made.
·,,Condition type group: It is defined which condition type groups are
available for this contract type. If no entry is made, all condition
types will be allowed for this contract type. The following field "title
condition group" is automatically filled with the corresponding title,
as defined within the condition type group.
·,,Condition type: Individual condition types that will available for
this contract type are listed. If no entry is made, all condition types
will be allowed for this contract type. The following field is
automatically completed with the corresponding description.
·,,Valid from / Valid to: The period of validity for the condition type
group or individual conditions for this contract type is to be defined.
Step3: Ranges of validity
Within this tab it can be define for which levels of process and
organizational levels a contract of the selected contract type can be
created.
It is mandatory to maintain at least one entry. Entries are directly
recorded in the view cluster for the selected contract types.
·,,Task level: The level of process for which contracts of this contract
type are created is defined.
·,,Organizational level: The organizational level which will be
available for the contract type is available. Then you can also select
the contract type for all subordinated organizational levels. If a
contract is available for each organizational level, the upper
organizational level must be maintained.
·,,Settling Company Code: The settling company code for the contract
type is entered, which leads to an exclusive settlement of through this
company code. For exclusive AD use, the settling company code is
irrelevant and therefore, maintenance is not required.
·,,Valid from/ until: This defines the period of validity within which
the contract type will be available within this range of validity.
Step4: Document definition
In the tab document definition, you define the forms for the contract.
At least one entry is mandatory in this tab. The entries are made via
the maintenance view /GICOM/VM_TDOC or via the cluster view
/GICOM/VC_CONTR within the sub-item definition of files.
·,,Contract language: Here you define the contract language for which
this form must be retrieved. The standard SAP language value help is
provided.
·,,Jurisdiction: Per document type a legal jurisdiction is stored where
the contract may be valid (for example, a department) and in which the
form is retrieved. The jurisdiction must coincide with the entered range
of validity.
·,,Valid from/to: Here you can the validity of the document assignment.
